data.title: code crashes when I leave it running overnight
data.body:
Every morning i have the crash screen waiting to greet me.
This happens with both production and insiders builds.
Is there a log i can send you so you can assign so you can match it with your crash logs assuming you are getting them from me.

data.title: disable autocomplete in .txt files
data.body:
The code completion functionality often gets in the way when typing prose into a text file. For example, if I were writing this comment in a .txt file with VS Code and tried to type the word fun immediately followed by the Enter key, I'd automatically have the word "functionality" instead, because Code "learned" from the first sentence above that "fun" might be the beginning of "functionality."

It's great that this is apparently turned off by default in Markdown files. Can the same default be applied to .txt files? It's unlikely that any useful word-completion heuristic can be deduced from the content of most text files.

data.title: Redesign Feedback Form dialog
data.body:
To resolve issue #2662 we're going to redesign the form to eliminate the input box. This makes sense because we are using twitter now. 

@bgashler1 hoping to get your help on this.

data.title: Nodejs Require autocomplete not working anymore
data.body:
Hi,
   I used VS Code since it launched, one of the feature i loved so much is the intellisense while adding a file using require when coding for node js.

After the latest update (Version: 0.10.8, Shell: 0.35.6) require intellisense is not working at all, it always says 'No suggestions'

Can someone help me to get the intellisense for 'require' command.

data.title: Change accelerator key for menu item: User Snippets from 'U' to 'S'
data.body:
I often like to go into the user settings, which should be just a `alt+f p u` away. However both the "User Settings" and "User Snippets" menu items have the same accelerator key: U, which means having to press Enter as well.
![menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6125444/13154994/e52c10cc-d67b-11e5-8959-e9770b1d6b5e.png)

So this commit changes the key or "User Snippets" from 'U' to 'S'. There's other instances of accelerator key duplication in the menus, but this one seemed easy to tackle.

data.body:


data.title: Debug and tasks should fetch latest configuration from disk
data.body:
**Repro**
1. Create a "project" that uses command-line arguments. In my case, a node.js command-line tool.
2. Modify the "configuration.args" in associated launch.json 
3. Press F5 to debug 

**Issue**
Modifications to launch.json in step 2 would not be used for step 3 until launch.json is explicitly saved (Ctrl+S). 'launch.json' is a special file and should probably be automatically saved on F5 or at least user should be warned it is on a modified state.

Visual Studio Code
Version 0.10.8
Commit db71ac615ddf9f33b133ff2536f5d33a77d4774e
Date 2016-02-05T10:10:11.194Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1

data.title: Allow customization of mouse shortcuts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Some users would like to be able to customize not just pure keyboard shortcuts but also mouse + modifier ones. These are currently hard coded, for example <kbd>alt</kbd>+click to add a selection.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3091 for some more context.

data.title: Opening a certain folder causes Code to lock up.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have tried opening code via the following command:
`code --disable-extensions .` but it doesnt seem to help.

Also it will work for about 3 or 4 seconds giving me enough time to open dev tools but I do not see any errors before it locks up completely.

Devtools seem to continue to work but the text window, explorer, and side bar are unresponsive.
Also the explorer doesnt seem to fully load. It only shows the header "Explorer": 

![screenshot 2016-02-18 09 40 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15068/13152381/bfc52b46-d623-11e5-9783-a10020696b23.png)

I am running version 0.10.8 currently on Windows 10.

This only happens for one particular folder that has ruby code in it. Other folders with ruby or other code open fine. There is no .vscode folder for this project so I am not sure where project specific settings might reside. It appears to try and open the same two files every time I open this folder.

Another thing, I moved my project to a different path and the issue seemed to go away but upon moving the project back to the previous location the issue returns.

Please let me know if there is any additional data I can provide that would be helpful.

data.title: Uncaught exception when calling connection.console.info()
code .  opens the current directory, code .. also opens the current directory - not the parent
data.body: `code .`  opens the current directory, `code ..` also opens the current directory - not the parent

data.title: Add keyboard shortcut for Intellisense full-text
data.body:
Currently, when Intellisense text is too long to be displayed, the user must click the **(i)** icon to reveal the whole text: ![january_intellisense-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/13150666/11459e90-d667-11e5-8388-703dcd5de60f.png) ![january_intellisense-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/13150880/e3b9bf28-d667-11e5-8511-ebe8d7cb6ea2.png)
It's rather cumbersome to be required to use the mouse or track pad for switching Intellisense content because the fingers are down on the keyboard when Intellisense comes into play.
I propose to introduce a keyboard shortcut to switch between "preview" and "full" Intellisense mode. Hitting that keyboard shortcut would emulate clicking the **(i)** and **<-** icons, resp. I suggest to use the ` + ` keyboard combination by default for the proposed functionality.

data.title: [snippets] Support snippet contribution on a specific file

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body: I would like to contribute snippets to .vscode/tasks.json. However currently I can only contribute snippets using the snippet extension point on a language mode.

data.title: Add EOL option
data.body: fyi @dbaeumer

data.title: Feature request: Go to method declaration
data.body:
Hi everyone, 
Thanks for the work on this editor and its open nature, it's a really good move from Microsoft, and a promising one.

The only 2 things missing from my point of view are: 
- a proper settings panel, I understand that it is not trivial, but it's something I guess people could get used to not have, so it's not what this issue is about.
-  a go-to-function shortcut, I find the ability to jump to a function by pressing Ctrl + R invaluable, and it's supported by Atom too, so it shouldn't be too much of a hassle to find the right package in the atom repo and port some of the code, I think a lot of people will find it useful too.

So it would be great to get it implemented!

Thank you in advance, 
Alvin

data.title: Add snippet support to tasks.json
Suggest wigets should react to mode changes.
data.body:
To reproduce:
- open a first json file
- quickly request code complete (best done programmatically by executing the code complete command )

``` typescript
this.keybindingService.executeCommand('editor.action.triggerSuggest');
```

Observe: the suggest widget is empty. The reason is that the json support now comes in through an extension that the json mode dynamically gets the suggest support. Since json starts a server this can take a while.

data.title: VScode restart do not bring back all opened projects
data.body:
If I have, for e.g., 4 instances of vscode opened with different projects and I restart or close vscode, when reopening it only opens one (and sometimes none) of the projects that were previously opened.

It should bring back all previous opened windows, like atom, sublime, textmate, etc.

data.title: Display the full workspace path in UI
data.body:
I have two workspaces:

`c:\docs\dev\version1\js`
and
`c:\docs\dev\version2\js`

If I open one VisualCode instance with the workspace `c:\docs\dev\version1\js` and another one with `c:\docs\dev\version2\js` there no easy way to know which window points to which workspace.

The only information that is displayed in the UI is the last folder of the workspace's path which is in both cases `js` so it's not really helpful.

It would be great if there was an option to show the full path to the workspace instead of the last folder in the UI.

data.title: add support for restarting debug session
data.body: If a TerminatedEvent has an attribute 'restart' and its value is true, the debug session is restarted. This can be used to automatically reattach to a node process that is relaunched by nodemon (see #2103)

data.title: Support to theme the entire workbench
data.body:
Currently, color themes are not getting applied to the toolbar on the left:

![code theme](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/13143860/1b82be62-d647-11e5-99e3-12cb81ed6d53.png)

I tend to believe this is not intentional as it inhibits accessibility, e.g. with high-contrast themes.

So I propose to have themes apply to the VS Code toolbar, too.

data.title: Assertion failed: object->InternalFieldCount() > 0
data.body:
When debugging a NodeJS Express.js POST method using Postman (The Chrome app) with babeljs transpiled code this error is thrown:
`Assertion failed: object->InternalFieldCount() > 0, file d:\jenkins\workspace\nodejs-msi-julien\d8c2e2bb\src\util-inl.h, line 117`
- This bug is reproducable over different POST url's.
- Developer Tools doesn't say anything.
  I'm not allowed to share code but if absolutely necessary I might try and create an isolated use case where it's reproducable...

How to reproduce:
- Create a NodeJS Express.js server with ES6 syntax and create a POST REST method, and transpile it using npm-babel (https://www.npmjs.com/package/babel).
- Place a breakpoint at the first entry point in your POST function
- Using Postman, send a POST request and wait
- It should first stop at the breakpoint and shortly after throw the error and exit the debugger.

data.title: Expose ConfigureTaskSystem action
vscode.d.ts: workspace.rootPath is read-only
data.body: Small change: added the `@readonly` flag to workspace.rootPath
